thread.title: China flags electricity, oil, rail sector reform
thread.title_full: China flags electricity, oil, rail sector reform | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: China flags electricity, oil, rail sector reform
text:
China's economic planner will roll out a pilot project on mixed-ownership in the electricity, oil, rail and airline sectors, in a bid to deepen reforms in the country's bloated state-owned enterprises, state media reported on Monday.
Liu He, a deputy director of the National Development and Reform Commission, made the remark at a state planner meeting, said China Securities Journal.
Beijing unveiled a project to further overhaul its inefficient state-owned enterprises on September 13, allowing them to partner with private investors to boost returns. The plan gives no definitive timeframe for reforms but says "decisive results" are expected by 2020.
The plan called for more private participation in state firms, but emphasized the Communist Party's control over companies.
